result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan D Zettle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Cooperate with truthful testimony of all his co-actors -  sister, mother, father and Timothy LeMere.

timeConds.notes: Stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.
To perform 25 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of conviction - Court imposes 30 days conditional jail time effective the date the order is signed.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bryan D Zettle in court with attorney Lawrence Gerard Vesely.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/09/15 by Dep. Schwartz. (fingerprint card destroyed 4/16/15)

To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Attorney Lawrence Gerard Vesely in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No appearance by defendant. Court reviews events in file, advises Atty Vesely that court requires defendant needs to appear in person for Initial Appearance. Court reschedules matter.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Defendant appears at 11:00 with Atty Vesely.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set. Status scheduled for 04/13/2015 at 1:15 pm.
